country_overview.content: Malaysia, located in Southeast Asia, is a melting pot of cultures, offering modern cities, beautiful beaches, and lush rainforests. The country welcomes millions of visitors annually for tourism, business, and education. Malaysia's visa policy is generally straightforward, with visa-free entry for citizens of many countries, as well as various visa options for longer stays or specific purposes.

tourist_visa.title: Tourist Visa
tourist_visa.description: Issued to foreign nationals who wish to visit Malaysia for tourism, sightseeing, and casual visits to friends or relatives.

business_visa.title: Business Visa
business_visa.description: For individuals visiting Malaysia for business meetings, trade negotiations, or other business-related activities.

student_visa.title: Student Visa
student_visa.description: Issued to students who have been accepted to a recognized educational institution in Malaysia.

employment_pass.title: Employment Pass
employment_pass.description: For foreign nationals employed by a Malaysian company or organization.

social_visit_visa.title: Social Visit Visa
social_visit_visa.description: For visits related to social, cultural, and family matters, including visiting relatives or participating in cultural exchanges.

tourist_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must demonstrate the purpose of their visit is purely for tourism and that they have sufficient funds to support themselves during their stay.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least six months of validity
Proof of travel arrangements (e.g., flight itinerary)

business_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must have an invitation from a Malaysian company or organization for business purposes.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least six months of validity
Letter of invitation from the Malaysian company
Company registration documents of the inviting company in Malaysia

student_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must have an acceptance letter from a recognized educational institution in Malaysia.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least six months of validity
Acceptance letter from the educational institution
Proof of financial means to support education and stay in Malaysia

step_1.title: Determine Visa Type
step_1.description: Identify the appropriate visa type based on the purpose of your visit to Malaysia.

step_2.title: Check Eligibility
step_2.description: Ensure that you meet the eligibility criteria for the selected visa type.

step_3.title: Gather Required Documents
step_3.description: Collect all mandatory and additional documents as specified for the visa type.

step_4.title: Fill Out the Application Form
step_4.description: Complete the visa application form available on the Malaysian government's official visa website.

step_5.title: Submit the Application
step_5.description: Submit the completed application form and documents either online or at the nearest Malaysian embassy or consulate.

step_6.title: Wait for Processing
step_6.description: Wait for the visa application to be processed. Processing times vary depending on the visa type and your country of residence.

step_7.title: Receive the Visa
step_7.description: Once approved, receive your visa either electronically or stamped in your passport.

visa_fees.content: Visa fees vary depending on the type of visa, duration of stay, and nationality of the applicant. The fees are non-refundable and must be paid at the time of application.

processing_time.content: Processing times can range from a few days to a few weeks, depending on the visa type and the applicant's country of residence.

visa_validity.content: Visa validity varies by visa type. Tourist visas are typically valid for 30 days, while business and employment visas may be valid for up to a year or more.

entry_requirements.content: Visa holders must enter Malaysia within the validity period of the visa. Overstaying a visa can result in fines or other penalties.

faq_1.question: Can I extend my visa while in Malaysia?
faq_1.answer: Certain types of visas can be extended, but this must be done before the current visa expires. Extensions are granted at the discretion of Malaysian authorities.

faq_2.question: Is visa-free entry available for Malaysia?
faq_2.answer: Yes, citizens of many countries can enter Malaysia visa-free for short stays, typically up to 90 days.

faq_3.question: Can I work in Malaysia on a tourist visa?
faq_3.answer: No, working on a tourist visa is strictly prohibited. You must apply for an employment pass if you intend to work in Malaysia.
